intro: Diplazium crassirhizoma, commonly known as the broad-rooted fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its robust, creeping rhizomes that give it its common name. The plant has compound fronds with pinnate divisions, and its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and rocky areas. The botanical features of Diplazium crassirhizoma make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
